description:
Split logic for defining custom types in schema_generated_bindings.js into separate files.


BUG=80310
TEST=


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=118070

messages.text:
lgtm

http://codereview.chromium.org/9179006/diff/2001/chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/chrome_setting_custom_bindings.js
File chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/chrome_setting_custom_bindings.js (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/9179006/diff/2001/chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/chrome_setting_custom_bindings.js#newcode11
chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/chrome_setting_custom_bindings.js:11: GetChromeHidden().registerCustomType('ChromeSetting', function(bindingsAPI) {
this naming convention is a bit confusing; my fault originally for calling the API "bindingsAPI' for the registerCustomHook stuff, it really should have been "hookAPI" or something.

but yeah, to avoid confusion (of some random person browsing these _custom_bindings.js files), perhaps call this "typesAPI" or something similar.

http://codereview.chromium.org/9179006/diff/2001/chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/content_settings_custom_bindings.js
File chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/content_settings_custom_bindings.js (right):

chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/content_settings_custom_bindings.js:7: (function() {
newline after this (sorry)

http://codereview.chromium.org/9179006/diff/2001/chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/experimental.storage_custom_bindings.js
File chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/experimental.storage_custom_bindings.js (right):

chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/experimental.storage_custom_bindings.js:27: // even generate) for other APIs that need to do this.
could you add "same for other callers of registerCustomType"

http://codereview.chromium.org/9179006/diff/2001/chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/schema_generated_bindings.js
File chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/schema_generated_bindings.js (right):

chrome/renderer/resources/extensions/schema_generated_bindings.js:343: // --- Setup additional APIs not currently handled in common/extensions/api
I think this comment is no longer relevant
(I don't have owners... you'll still need to wait for aa)

Thanks, Ben!
